remarks: A Hilbert subspace is closed iff it is complete.  A complete subspace is one in which every Cauchy sequence of vectors in the subspace converges to a member of the subspace (Definition of complete subspace in [Beran] p. 96).  Remark 3.12 of [Beran] p. 107.  (Contributed by NM, 24-Dec-2001.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 14-May-2014.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
isch3 $p |- ( H e. CH <-> ( H e. SH /\ A. f e. Cauchy ( f : NN --> H -> E. x e. H f ~~>v x ) ) ) $.
$d H f x $.
